physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Chronic diarrhea, total villous atrophy confirmed by biopsy.
Repeat small-bowel biopsy confirmed total villous atrophy; presence of antibodies to enterocytes indicating autoimmune enteropathy.

2- to 15-mm pruritic, excoriated papules and nodules on extremities and trunk. Papulovesicular lesions on shoulder. Skin biopsy showed focal spongiotic dermatitis with subcorneal vesiculo-pustule formation consistent with eczema.
Development of widespread bullous lesions, skin biopsy showed a subepidermal blister compatible with bullous pemphigoid.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Gradual resolution of bullae after addition of dapsone and intravenous immunoglobulin.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Second episode of blister formation with persistent nodules unresponsive to various treatments; biopsy showed features consistent with pemphigoid nodularis.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Addition of rituximab resulted in marked improvement of skin lesions and allowed discontinuation of oral prednisone.
